thread.title: World View: China Announces It Will Block Imports of North Korea’s Coal
thread.title_full: World View: China Announces It Will Block Imports of North Korea’s Coal

author: John J. Xenakis
title: World View: China Announces It Will Block Imports of North Korea’s Coal
text: FILE - This combination of file photos shows Kim Jong Nam, left, exiled half-brother of North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un, in Narita, Japan, on May 4, 2001, and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on May 9, 2016, in Pyongyang, North Korea. Kim Jong Nam, 46, was targeted Monday, Feb. 13, 2017, in a shopping concourse at Kuala Lumpur International Airport, Malaysia, and died on the way to the hospital, according to a Malaysian government official. (AP Photos/Shizuo Kambayashi, Wong Maye-E, File)
